titles.title: Bank and Thrift Statute of Limitations Clarification Act of 1994
A bill to clarify the statute of limitations for actions brought by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the Resolution Trust Corporation as conservator or receiver.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4347-4348)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 4/14/1994--Introduced. Bank and Thrift Statute of Limitations Clarification Act of 1994 - Amends the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to provide that the statute of limitations regarding an action brought by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation as conservator or receiver begins to run with the date of its appointment in that capacity, regardless of whether the claim was barred by State law at the date of such appointment (unless the claim was barred more than five years before).
